sentence.Network_en: The movie's special effects fail to dazzle.
sentence.Network_cn: 这部电影的特效未能出彩。

sentence.Network_en: The dazzle of stardom and status attracts them.
sentence.Network_cn: 明星的光彩和地位吸引着他们。

sentence.Network_en: It's a long time since I went out on the razzle - dazzle, but your birthday will be a wonderful excuse.
sentence.Network_cn: 我好久没出去找乐子了, 你过生日倒是一个好借口.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (in the sense 'be dazzled'): frequentative of the verb daze

entry.def: If someone or something dazzles you, you are extremely impressed by their skill, qualities, or beauty.

example.ex: George dazzled her with his knowledge of the world...
example.tran: 乔治的洞察世情令她叹服。

example.ex: The movie's special effects fail to dazzle.
example.tran: 这部电影的特效未能出彩。

entry.tran: 辉煌;灿烂;艳丽;令人赞叹的特质
entry.def: The dazzle of something is a quality it has, such as beauty or skill, which is impressive and attractive.

example.ex: The dazzle of stardom and status attracts them.
example.tran: 明星的光彩和地位吸引着他们。

entry.def: If a bright light dazzles you, it makes you unable to see properly for a short time.

example.ex: The sun, glinting from the pool, dazzled me...
example.tran: 在太阳的照射下，池面上泛起粼粼波光，让我一时睁不开眼。

example.ex: Kelly was dazzled by the lights.
example.tran: 灯光照得凯莉有些眼晕。

entry.def: The dazzle of a light is its brightness, which makes it impossible for you to see properly for a short time.

example.ex: The sun's dazzle on the water hurts my eyes.
example.tran: 水面上耀眼的阳光刺痛了我的眼睛。
可以去除眩光的滤光片

means.word_mean: 1. brightness enough to blind partially and temporarily
1. to cause someone to lose clear vision, especially from intense light;

sentences.sentence: "She was dazzled by the bright headlights"

means.word_mean: 2. amaze or bewilder, as with brilliant wit or intellect or skill;

sentences.sentence: "The dancer dazzled the audience with his turns and jumps"

auth_sentence.content: Spending millions on advertising and razzle-dazzle promotional stunts.
auth_sentence.res_content: Spending millions on advertising and razzle-dazzle promotional stunts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Spending millions on advertising and razzle-dazzle promotional stunts.

auth_sentence.content: They...contain an in-built device to ensure that no dazzle occurs.
auth_sentence.res_content: They...contain an in-built device to ensure that no dazzle occurs.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They...contain an in-built device to ensure that no dazzle occurs.

auth_sentence.content: Cover her face; mine eyes dazzle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Cover her face; mine eyes dazzle.

Sentence.sentence: Songs like "Tomorrow Never Knows", "Strawberry Fields Forever", and "A Day in the Life" featured revolutionary sound effects that dazzled and mystified Martin's American counterparts.

sentences.en: The bright morning sun dazzled him.
sentences.cn: 早晨明亮的阳光照得他睁不开眼。

sentences.en: I can't see because the light is dazzling me.
sentences.cn: 因为光线使我眼花, 所以我看不见。

sentences.en: The splendid hall dazzled the young man.
sentences.cn: 富丽堂皇的大厅使那年轻人眼花缭乱。

sentences.en: Such prospects almost dazzled the young girl.
sentences.cn: 如此光辉的前景几乎使小姑娘眼花缭乱。

sentences.en: To look straight at the sun dazzled the eye.
sentences.cn: 直接看太阳会使人目眩。

sentences.en: She was dazzled by bright lights when she came into the room.
sentences.cn: 她走进屋内时被强光刺得睁不开眼。

sentences.en: He dazzled the crowd with his oratory.
sentences.cn: 他的雄辩口才使听众赞叹不已。

sentences.en: The student was dazzled by his sudden success.
sentences.cn: 突如其来的成功使那学生感到惊讶。

sentences.en: Put on dark glasses or the sun will dazzle you and you won't be able to see.
sentences.cn: 戴上墨镜，否则耀眼的阳光会让你看不见任何东西。

jushi.english: The bright morning sun dazzled him.
jushi.chinese: 早晨明亮的阳光照得他睁不开眼。

jushi.english: He dazzled the crowd with his oratory.
jushi.chinese: 他的雄辩口才使听众赞叹不已。

jushi.english: The student was dazzled by his sudden success.
jushi.chinese: 突如其来的成功使那学生感到惊讶。
